snippet: The ban signed by President Goodluck Jonathan threatens violators with prison terms, and is considered the most significant setback to gay rights in Africa.
abstract: Nigerian Pres Goodluck Jonathan signs tough ban on same-sex relationships that threatens violators with 14-year prison terms; law in Africa's most populous nation is considered most significant setback to gay rights on the continent.

byline.contributor: Musikilu Mojeed contributed reporting from Abuja, Nigeria.

lead_paragraph: The ban signed by President Goodluck Jonathan threatens violators with prison terms, and is considered the most significant setback to gay rights in Africa.

headline.main: Nigerian President Signs Ban on Same-Sex Relationships
headline.print_headline: Nigerian President Signs Ban on Same-Sex Relationships

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
